summary:
Senior procurement professional with more than 40 years of service in private and public sector procurement and extensive experience in tendering, evaluation and contracting.  Familiar with the guidelines and  procedures of the EU, WorldBank and the major international donors/lenders.  From 1998 to 2000 participated, at the request of the EU, in a study related to “Project Horizon 2000” on harmonisation of procurement rules and guidelines in the EU member states. Experience in procurement capacity assessments and independent procurement reviews and audits for Dutch Development Aid, DANIDA, Sida, KfW, the World Bank and for the Global Fund. More recently involved in development of procurement manuals and revision of procurement law and regulations in the Strenghtening Public Procurement Programme ISP3 in Indonesia.

Drafting of plans and guidelines for Sustainable Procurement.

Has reported extensively on assessments and findings to various relevant organisations.

projects.title: Bosnia &Herzegovina, capacity assessment
projects.description: Assessment of the procurement and financial system capacity of the project implementation units (PIU) at entity level viz. Odraz’ in the federation BiH (Sarajevo) and ‘Fund for Development and Employment’ in the Republika Srpska (Banja Luka) for services to the enterprise sector revitalisation fund (ESRF) financed by SIDA

projects.title: India Rajasthan, Independent Procurement Review
projects.description:
IPR Procurement Audit in Sectors Education, Power and Irrigation financed by the WorldBank
Assessment of staff, organisation and procedures used in contracts in several PIUs

projects.title: NELSAP, Nile Based Action Plan
projects.description:
Nile Basin Action Plan (NELSAP) financed by SIDA, activities at Head Office and Country Office both at Kigali:
Activities:
Systems audit
(i)	Report on the present structure of the procurement function within the PMUs and NELSAP-CU. Report on the procurement personnel in terms of organisation, qualifications, knowledge and capacity.
(ii)	 Verificaton of the procurement processes in place for recruitment of the PMU’s staff and NELSAP-CU staff 
(iii)	Verification of  the processes in place for procurement of goods by the PMUs and NELSAP-CU.
(iv)	Review the efficiency of procurement by the  PMUs and NELSAP-CU.  Report on the quality of procurement and contracting; and identify reasons for delays, if any. Determine whether adequate systems are in place for procurement planning, implementation and monitoring. Verify that adequate documentation is maintained for record purposes.
(v)	Recommendations for  actions for improvement of the procurement function of the PMUs and NELSAP-CU organizations.

Compliance audit of selected sample procurements
(i)	Determined whether the procedures, processes and documentation for procurement of goods were in accordance with specific Agreements between Sida/NORAD and NBI, and followed established regulations.
(ii)	Determined whether the procedures, processes and documentation for the recruitment of PMU staff were in accordance with specific Agreements between Sida/NORAD and NBI, and followed established regulations
(iii)	Analyzed how procurement factors and procurement constraints have influenced project implementation
(iv)	Checked to what extent the Small Scale Investment Project has been utilized and if so has it been used in accordance with written routines for procurement (who has the right to make decisions, up to what amount? Who issued the no objection);

projects.title: Guinea
projects.description:
Assessment of the National Procurement Procedures of Guinea and their suitability for use in the proposed basket funding scheme and an assessment of the procurement capacity of the procurement unit of the Ministry of Education, Financed by KfW 
Activities:


•	Analysed the national procurement procedures whether they are in line with international best practise
•	Compared and reported on the procurement procedures of the KfW, Worldbank and AfDBank and report on their application in Guinea
•	Evaluated the procurement procedures used in other ‘pooled funds’ in Africa( e.g. Mozambique, Niger)
•	In line with the above evaluations advised and proposed on the procurement procedures to be used for ‘pooled funds’ in  Guinea
•	Analysed the procurement capacity of the Ministry of Education in applying the proposed procedures and advise on training

projects.title: Tanzania, Procurement Monitoring Programme
projects.description:
Procurement Monitoring Programme, financed by the Worldbank
The programme provided the following services
•	To map out the procurement activities of Procuring Entities in relation to other activities within the organization in order to understand how procurement activities can be monitored and controlled
•	To study and understand other monitoring system in place to monitor the Procuring Entities in as far as public expenditure is concerned as a basis of setting a system that will complement and not in conflict with existing systems
•	To clearly articulate the role of PPRA and that of various structures within the Procuring Entities dealing with procurement activities
•	To study the existing a system of reporting of procurement activities within the Procuring Entities and with the CTB/PPRA
•	To establish a system for checking and monitoring the procurement process of the procuring entities
•	To set and implement the system in five Pilot Procuring Entities including Ministry of Works, Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security, Ministry of Health, TANROADS and TANESCO

Activities focussed on designing Guidelines for the system for monitoring and evaluation the procurement process in Tanzania

projects.title: Benin & Burkina Faso
projects.description: Procurement Appraisal for DANIDA Programmes, monitoring of procurement activities performed by Danish Embassy staff. Reported also on the performance of the appointed procurement agent in these countries.

projects.title: Bangladesh, Independent Procurement Review
projects.description:
IPR Procurement Audit for road-, power- and education Projects financed by WB 
Assessment of staff, organisation and procedures used in contracts in several PIUs in Dhaka

projects.title: Senegal, Global Fund Program
projects.description:
The Global Fund Programme to fight HIV, TB and Malaria, financed by the Global Fund
assessment of the procurement capacities of PIUs and relevant staff.

projects.title: ORIO projects:Donor Netherlands Ministry of Economic Affairs in a program to promote Joint Ventures or cooperation between Indonesian and Dutch Contractors.
projects.description: Assessment of tenderdocuments for construction works and/or market conformity of prices of production equipment for several projects co-financed by the Netherlands Ministry of Economic Affairs in different countries, including a.o. equipment for flower and plant growing, food production, shoe and cloth manufacturing and vaccin production.

projects.title: ISP3, Strengthening Public Procurement Programme, Indonesia
projects.description: Strengthening Public Procurement Programme (ISP3), financed by AusAID, activities: International Procurement Advisor working alongside counterpart LKPP in reviewing and final drafting of procurement manuals to support guidelines under Keppres 80 and advising on procurement best practise for revision of Keppres 80. Moreover assist as requested  by the Team Leader, sub-national governments, of either selected provinces or districts, to strengthen their public procurement systems, including enhancing the accountability of provincial/district project managers and tender committees.

projects.title: Malawi, Independent Procurement Review
projects.description:
IPR Procurement Audit for second following year for Health Projects financed by WB ‘Swap Funds’: 
Assessment of staff, organisation and procedures used in contracts in several hospitals and health organisations throughout the country

projects.title: Danida, The Danish Ministry for Development Cooperation
projects.description:
Designed Terms of Reference for DANIDA for the appointment of  Procurement Agent(s) for 15 Programme Countries. Assistance in the selection and appointment of Procurement Agents for DANIDA Programmes.
Monitored all procurement activities of the appointed Procurement Agents in 15 DANIDA Programme Countries for a period of two consecutive years
Benin and Burkina Faso
Procurement Appraisal for DANIDA Programmes, monitoring of procurement activities performed by Danish Embassy staff. Reported also on the performance of the appointed procurement agent in these countries.

projects.title: Mozambique
projects.description:
Supervised the selection of suppliers for the Essential Drugs Kits Programme of the Ministry of Health. The project was financed by the Netherlands Development Aid. 
An appraisal mission initiated by DANIDA was undertaken to report on the performance of the appointed procurement agent in the remote areas of Mozambique

projects.title: INDONESIA Projects
projects.description:
Various projects in Jakarta, as well as in Sumatra, Maluku, Kalimantan, Sulawesi and Irian Jaya.
-	Upgrading facilities for medical care, 80 hospitals all over Indonesia, renovation of
              construction, upgrading equipment, training of medical and technical staff
-	Streamlining Family Planning Programmes.
-	Budgeting and procurement of IUD’s and pills.
-	Procurement of tugboats and container-cranes, for harbours in Jakarta, Surabaya and
              Belawan.
-	Rehabilitation of salt fields in Madura.
-	Drinking water projects, infrastructure, flow limitation on West Java.
-	Procurement and monitoring construction of diesel power plants
			(8x25MW).

Procurement auditing of the whole procurement cycle
